marketNews.title: DHE SDA Revision: 100% Portion for 1 Year
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Tuesday (21/1) that the government will revise the regulation on the placement of export proceeds from natural resources (DHE SDA) to mandate 100% placement for 1 year. This portion and tenor of placement is larger and longer compared to the existing regulation, which requires a minimum of 30% for 3 months. Airlangga said that the revision of the DHE SDA placement regulation will be effective starting March 1, 2025, for SDA exporters with an export value of at least 250,000 US dollars. Airlangga also mentioned that the revision of this regulation is currently in the harmonization stage and will be issued shortly. Airlangga claimed that the government will provide many incentives for the mineral and coal sectors as well as other natural resources, except for the oil and natural gas sector. These incentives include: - 0% WHT rate on interest income from DHE SDA placement instruments. - Exporters can utilize DHE SDA placement instruments as back-to-back collateral for rupiah credit from banks or the Investment Management Institution (LPI) for domestic rupiah needs. - Exporters can utilize swap instruments with banks if they need rupiah for their business activities. - Provision of guaranteed funds - including collateral in the form of cash collateral, current accounts, up to savings deposits - meeting certain requirements will be excluded from the maximum credit provision limit (BMPK), so that fund provision using DHE SDA placement instruments as collateral will not affect the gearing ratio against equity. - DHE SDA can be converted into rupiah and will be calculated as a reduction in the mandatory placement percentage. - Foreign exchange instruments can be used for payment of state levies such as taxes, royalties, and dividends. The revision of the DHE SDA placement regulation itself is aimed at increasing domestic foreign exchange supply to alleviate pressure on the rupiah. As of Tuesday (21/1), the rupiah to US dollar exchange rate had fallen -0.9% MoM to the level of 16,335. Airlangga claimed that the revision of DHE SDA placement could increase state foreign exchange reserves by up to 90 billion US dollars, equivalent to 58% of the 2024 realization of 156 billion US dollars. Nevertheless, the regulation revision has been criticized by exporters. Before Airlangga announced the revision changes for DHE SDA placement, the General Chairman of the Indonesian Exporters Association, Benny Soetrisno, stated on Monday (20/1) that the revised regulation would disrupt exporter finances, given that export dollars must be placed domestically while exporter financing has mostly originated from foreign financial institutions. To ease the burden on exporters, Airlangga mentioned last week that the yield interest rate on term deposits for DHE SDA placement will be higher than in Singapore, which is in the range of 4.12-4.48%, although he did not elaborate further. Last week, Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, also mentioned that Bank Indonesia is preparing SUVBI and SVBI as additional instruments for DHE SDA placement, besides existing instruments such as foreign exchange term deposits and FX swaps. Key Takeaway: At first glance, the revision of the DHE SDA placement regulation has the potential to provide a positive sentiment for banking issuers along with the addition of foreign exchange liquidity. Meanwhile, there is a risk of operational working capital liquidity for exporters who do not have a strong balance sheet (cash). However, further clarity and details regarding the incentives that exporters will receive are still needed to measure the impact of the DHE SDA rule change on exporters.

marketNews.title: Donald Trump inaugurated as US President; Announces policy discussions including trade tariffs and energy exploration.
marketNews.content: Donald Trump was officially inaugurated as US President on Monday (20/1). During his inauguration, Trump announced a number of policy discussions, including plans to open more areas for oil and gas exploration, the implementation of a 25% import tariff for Canada and Mexico effective February 1, 2025, a delay in import tariffs for China, halting electric vehicle subsidies, stopping the TikTok ban in the US, and withdrawing the US from the 2015 Paris Agreement and WHO.

marketNews.title: Kuwaiti Oil Company KUFPEC Plans IDR 155 Trillion Investment in Aceh Oil and Gas Sector
marketNews.content: The Head of the Aceh Oil and Gas Management Agency, Nasri Djalal, stated on Monday (20/1) that the Kuwaiti oil and gas company, Kuwait Foreign Petroleum Exploration Company (KUFPEC), plans to invest 10 billion US dollars for the exploration and development of oil and gas resources in Aceh. Meanwhile, KUFPEC Country Manager, Sara Al-Baker, said that they are currently evaluating investment opportunities in Indonesia. Previously, Sara stated in December 2024 that KUFPEC was conducting studies and exploring opportunities in the Natuna D-Alpha gas block, and plans to participate in future government oil and gas block tenders.

marketNews.title: CPO Price Forecasts for 2025
marketNews.content: The consensus of analysts surveyed by Reuters expects CPO prices in the futures market to rise 5.4% YoY in 2025 to 4,350 ringgit per ton. This expectation is based on the implementation of B40 biodiesel in Indonesia which will reduce exports in the global market. The CEO of the Malaysian Palm Oil Association, Roslin Azmy Hassan, estimates that the implementation of B40 will absorb an additional 1.2-1.7 million tons of Indonesian CPO. The consensus forecasts that Indonesian CPO production will increase +1.9% YoY in 2025 to 49.8 million tons. Meanwhile, Malaysia - the second-largest CPO producer in the world - is projected to produce 19.5 million tons of CPO in 2025 (+0.83% YoY) amidst adverse weather, labor shortages, and low replanting rates.

marketNews.title: BYD Targets Completion of Indonesian Plant by End of 2025
marketNews.content: The Director of PT BYD Motor Indonesia, Eagle Zhou, stated that his company aims to complete the construction of its plant in Indonesia by the end of 2025, on schedule. The 1 billion US dollar plant - located in the Subang Smartpolitan industrial area owned by Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) - will have a production capacity of 150,000 electric vehicles per year and is targeted to serve the export market in the long term. Although it first made deliveries in Indonesia in June 2024, BYD recorded wholesale sales of 15,429 units as of the end of 2024, equivalent to 35.7% of the total Battery Electric Vehicle (BEV) market share in Indonesia during 2024.

tickerNews.title: Japfa Ltd. Parent Company in Share Transaction Discussion
tickerNews.content: Japfa Ltd. (SGX: JAP) Board of Directors - the parent company of Japfa Comfeed Indonesia - announced that it is currently in further discussions regarding a possible transaction of Japfa Ltd. shares, although they did not elaborate further. Previously, Bloomberg reported in March 2024 that the owner of Japfa Ltd. was considering taking the company private. The Board of Directors of Japfa Ltd. in the information disclosure only explained that they have not made any decisions, and emphasized that there is no guarantee that any transaction will occur. As of 9M24, JPFA contributed 76% of Japfa Ltd.'s total revenue which reached 3.4 billion US dollars.

tickerNews.title: CBDK to Acquire PT Industri Pameran Nusantara via New Share Issuance
tickerNews.content: Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) announced a plan to acquire PT Industri Pameran Nusantara from an affiliated party through the issuance of 135 million new shares valued at 2.3 trillion rupiah. This transaction is part of the utilization plan for IPO proceeds. After this transaction, CBDK's ownership in PT Industri Pameran Nusantara increased from none to 99.99%. The funds obtained by PT Industri Pameran Nusantara will be used to finance the construction project for meetings, incentives, conferences, and exhibitions (MICE) buildings.

tickerNews.title: GOTO Targets 2x Growth in Consumer Loan Distribution for 2025
tickerNews.content: Head of Corporate Affairs GoTo Financial, Audrey P. Petriny, told Bisnis that the company targets consumer loan disbursement of 8.6 trillion rupiah in 2025, growing 2x compared to the realization during 9M24 at 4.3 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: DNET Subsidiary Secures IDR 5.9 Trillion Credit Facility from BMRI and BRIS
tickerNews.content: Indoritel Makmur Internasional through its subsidiary, PT Mega Akses Persada, signed a credit facility of up to 5.9 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BRIS). The facility has a tenor of 13 years and is intended for refinancing fiber optic network equipment and capital expenditure in 2025-2027. The facility has a fixed interest rate of 7.5% per year and a floating interest rate with a reference rate (BI Rate) plus a minimum margin of 1%.

tickerNews.title: HEAL Director Purchases Shares
tickerNews.content: Medicaloka Hermina Director, Tan Suryanti Gunadi, bought 124,000 HEAL shares at an average price of 1,595 rupiah per share on January 17, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 198 million rupiah. After this transaction, Tan Suryanti Gunadi's ownership in HEAL increased from 0.0286% to 0.0294%.

tickerNews.title: IPCC Records Cargo Handling Increase in 2024
tickerNews.content: Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal (IPCC) recorded an increase in handled cargo to 1,057,831 units during 2024 (+15% YoY), with the number of vessel calls to the company's managed docks also rising to 2,978 calls (+42% YoY). In addition, IPCC also recorded an increase in handling completely built up (CBU) imported cargo to 856,870 units during 2024 (+7.49% YoY), with handling of truck or bus cargo reaching 174,609 units (+69.21% YoY).

tickerNews.title: MYOH Targets 35 Million BCM Overburden Removal Volume in 2025
tickerNews.content: Samindo Resources Corporate Secretary, Ahmad Zaki, stated that the company targets an overburden removal volume of 35 million bcm in 2025 (vs. 2024 target: 30.7 million bcm), with a target coal production volume of 6 million tons (vs. 2024 target: 5.4 million tons). Ahmad mentioned that the increase in the 2025 target is based on the opportunity presented by high coal demand - especially from China and Southeast Asian countries - as well as domestic energy needs for power plants and smelters. MYOH allocates a capital expenditure (capex) of 13 million US dollars in 2025, which is intended for optimizing operational units and more sustainable spare part management, among others.

tickerNews.title: MBSS Announces Sale of Floating Crane Barge
tickerNews.content: Mitrabahtera Segara Sejati (MBSS) announced the sale of 1 unit of floating crane barge owned by its subsidiary, PT Mitra Galley Segara Sejati, to a non-affiliated party. The total transaction value reached approximately 4.3 million US dollars or approximately 70 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: LOPI Controller Sells Shares for Investment Strategy
tickerNews.content: The controller and President Director of Logisticsplus International (LOPI), Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko, sold 25.5 million LOPI shares at an average price of 63 rupiah per share on January 13, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 1.6 billion rupiah and was intended for investment strategy. After this transaction, Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko's ownership in LOPI decreased from 39.3% to 37%.
